title: French Lentils With Caramelized Celery Root And Parsley
summary: French Lentils With Caramelized Celery Root And Parsley is a gluten free and vegan recipe with 4 servings. One portion of this dish contains about 12g of protein, 4g of fat, and a total of 217 calories. For $1.58 per serving, this recipe covers 23% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. A mixture of olive oil, coarse salt and pepper, flat-leaf parsley, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 56 minutes. It is a reasonably priced recipe for fans of Mediterranean food. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 91%. This score is spectacular. Similar recipes include Spiced Pork with Celery Root Purée and Lentils, Spiced Pork With Celery Root Purée And Lentils, and Roasted Celery Root with Cumin and Parsley.

winePairing.pairingText: Bordeaux, Champagne, and White Burgundy are my top picks for French. French wine is just as diverse as French food, but you rarely go wrong with champagne. If your meal calls for a white wine, you might also try a white burgundy. For a red, try a red bordeaux blend. One wine you could try is Chateau Le Grand Moulin Cotes de Bordeaux Blaye. It has 4.8 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 15 dollars.

productMatches.title: Chateau Le Grand Moulin Cotes de Bordeaux Blaye
productMatches.description: Mostly Merlot, with Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, and Malbec and aged in cement vats. Generous, ripe and fruit forward aromas of dark currant, blackberry, cassis, mint, and spice with touches of earthiness. The medium bodied palate has nice balanced aromas supported by refined, textured tannins and balanced acidity. The finish is savory with earthy flavors and very good length.
